name: TheAtlantic
text: "How exactly has a self-declared billionaire avoided federal taxation for the better part of this century? Do these records prove that he’s poor, or astonishingly good at hiding how rich he is?" @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/BIIxu5s4Td

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump could not be anything other than who he is: a con artist; a person living in a world of lies and illusions; a cruel, lonely, rootless, and deeply broken man ... Now comes the reckoning," writes @Peter_Wehner. https://t.co/7dn1roVukY

name: TheAtlantic
text: What do the country's great dynasties reveal about how modern Chinese leaders may wield their power? Look to their policies and practices, @MichaelSchuman writes: https://t.co/QplxbVSINy

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Kayleigh McEnany, the White House press secretary, has tested positive for COVID-19.

Trump’s irresponsibility made the outbreak among GOP officials likely, @olgakhazan and @russellberman wrote earlier this morning. https://t.co/OVHkBS6dvH

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump is not, and never was, Richard III, or indeed any of Shakespeare’s other great villains, such as Iago or Macbeth," writes @EliotACohen: https://t.co/B28ech46yr

name: TheAtlantic
text: Levels of trust in America—in our institutions, in our politics, and in one another—are in precipitous decline. And when social trust collapses, nations fail. Can we get it back before it’s too late? @nytdavidbrooks on America’s moral convulsion: https://t.co/M8dj6e6FSC

name: TheAtlantic
text: "That distant referendum in Chile offers the U.S. an example of how ordinary people can, through peaceful mobilization and decisive action, save their republic from an authoritarian figure," Ariel Dorfman writes: https://t.co/iuegfabwKl

name: TheAtlantic
text: "'Emily in Paris' operates like a high-end perfume ad: cinematic in looks, low-stakes in plot, and somehow so strangely captivating that you can’t look away," writes @shirklesxp: https://t.co/AWfB31nAN7

name: TheAtlantic
text: “The ability to identify the right things to be afraid of is a heritable trait in some species,” @rebeccagiggs writes. “Where does the line fall between instinctive fears and those acquired via culture?” https://t.co/Lypam43Q9q

name: TheAtlantic
text: Pundits continually predict that the laws of political gravity will kick in for Boris Johnson, that he will topple under the weight of his own character flaws. But as @tommctague argues, Johnson is different from those who came before him. https://t.co/7xIVFfcG2e

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TomMcTague: Boris says the pandemic will trigger social and economic change. The old world isn’t coming back. What will the new world look like? I took a look https://t.co/trQ4IjDYAI

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @slaskow: Osteopathic medicine started with a midwestern healer who dabbled in magnetic healer. But in the past decades it's been folded into mainstream medicine, @elliepses reports https://t.co/wB1khftOQv

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YAppelbaum: "When the fire dies out and the fury subsides, what is the true American carnage wrought by and in the Trump White House?”

@CarlosLozadaWP read through 150 books on the presidency to find his answers, which may surprise you: https://t.co/SPFVpWtzln

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @AdrienneLaF: “Pessimism is irresponsible. Nihilism is immoral. Here’s what you can do to protect our democracy from now until November 3 and beyond.” 
Must-read @anneapplebaum: https://t.co/JwFdFWp50o

name: TheAtlantic
text: Donald Trump’s return to the White House threatens to further an outbreak of his own making. Then: Should you throw away all traces of your ex? In a new “Dear Therapist,” Lori Gottlieb weighs in. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/SAHyf7iloZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sign up for the newsletter here: https://t.co/ZY4adCYUKG

name: TheAtlantic
text: COVID craziness. Toddler tantrums. Unnerved staffers. What the lunacy in the Trump White House reveals about the degradation of America’s democratic values. @CarlosLozadaWP on the Chaos Chronicles: https://t.co/3stxaXQ29I

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @julieebeck: an interesting nugget from this delightful conversation — sometimes the same people who hate talking on the phone will happily chat over the video game headset for hours

https://t.co/lawfqtODmf

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Millions of Americans had simultaneously decided the same thing: If we’re going to be inside, it might as well be the inside we want,” @amandamull writes. https://t.co/cD0PHaHjui

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: There are many ways that sustainability can increase resilience. @BlackRock explains why investing in sustainability could accelerate economic recovery. https://t.co/6h2JkN2VZP https://t.co/VszR4uRq5x

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @anneapplebaum: Worried about the election? Don't despair. Here’s what you can do to protect our democracy, starting now, until November 3 and beyond.
https://t.co/k9y9syFT4X

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @amandamull: I wrote about the nation, deprived of much else to do, repainting its kitchens and upgrading its shower heads and considering some new bed linens. https://t.co/5znBN5cxkR

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The mask is off. After months of flirting with the notion, Trump is now explicit about his plan for the pandemic: He has none," writes @GrahamDavidA. "He wants Americans to take the punch, take the deaths, and pretend all is fine." https://t.co/ur39iQCphp

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "For reasons that need no elucidation, I spent a few hours this morning watching Benito Mussolini, the dictator of Italy from 1925 to 1945, performing in the old newsreel clips that now float around the internet." https://t.co/2pfgHvv7xL

name: TheAtlantic
text: Over the weekend, floodwater from a heavy storm destroyed buildings, bridges, and roads in a mountainous region of southeastern France. So far, at least 12 deaths have been reported, and 20 people remain missing. Via @theAtlPhoto: https://t.co/iq7MeGKtJP https://t.co/wt0mJ7zXv9

name: TheAtlantic
text: Since reopening in August, American movie theaters have only offered audiences one big-budget blockbuster. Without another, they’re doomed, @davidlsims writes. https://t.co/XDyKxniveZ
